This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The Frey Family Papers primarily document multiple generations of the Frey and related Ludlow and Van Schaack families of upstate New York and elsewhere. The bulk of the collection is correspondence (16 boxes), detailing family news, health matters, and deaths; opinions on religion, politics, and the Civil War; financial, legal, and property issues and troubles; family history and genealogy.

p.value: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.) Researchers on site may print out unlimited copies from microfilm reader-printer machines at per-exposure rates. See guidelines in Reading room for details.
This collection should be cited as the Frey Family Papers, The New-York Historical Society.
Many individuals in this collection had nicknames and used them often in correspondence. The following nicknames are commonly used:

The Frey Family Papers support research in the histories of New York State (major locations represented include Palatine Bridge, Oswego, New York City, Albany, Kinderhook); nineteenth century family life and religion; the Civil War; and late nineteenth century western history (letters of Caroline Frey Winne). This collection also supports research in nineteenth century women's history. The letters of Caroline Ludlow Frey, Christina Cantine, Elizabeth Van Schaack Frey, Anna Ludlow, Ellen Ludlow, and Helen Ludlow, for example, discuss family and social lives, health, religion, childrearing, politics, and current events (see subseries descriptions for details). In addition, the Frey Family Papers contain a number of letters written by children. See especially Caroline Frey ["Carrie" b.1868], Helen Frey, John Frey ["Johnny" d.1858], Wallace Jones, and Charles K. Winne, Jr.

subject.value: Indians of North America--Rites and ceremonies.

corpname.value: United States. Army. New York Infantry Regiment, 110th (1862-1865)

dsc.value:
Series I: Correspondence, 1793-1917, undated Scope and Contents note

Sixteen boxes. Arranged alphabetically by sender, into 102 subseries. Letters with multiple authors are filed under the first name to appear. Women, if married, are filed under their final surname.

 Subseries 1. Letters sent, A Letters sent, A 1 1 Subseries 2. Backus, E.F., 1833-1836 Scope and Contents note

Letters concern land purchase, property.

 Letters sent, Backus, E.F. 1 2 1833-1836 Subseries 3. Baldwin family, 1793-1900 Scope and Contents note

Letters concern family news, deaths, and history.

 Letters sent, Baldwin family 1 3 1793-1900 Subseries 4. Ball, Amy, 1899-1900 Scope and Contents note

Letters to Samuel Ludlow Frey regarding family history and genealogy.

 Letters sent, Ball, Amy 1 4 1899-1900 Subseries 5. Ball, Jane G., 1861-1898 Scope and Contents note

Letters concerning family matters.

 Letters sent: Ball, Jane G. 1 5 1861-1898 Subseries 6. Ball, Margaret, 1859-1878, undated Scope and Contents note

Letters regarding family matters, health, current events.

 Letters sent: Ball, Margaret 1 6 1859-1878, undated Subseries 7. Barber, Edwin A., 1881-1912 Scope and Contents note

Letters to Samuel Ludlow Frey regarding pottery, china, stoneware.

 Letters sent: Barber, Edwin A. 1 7 1881-1912, undated Subseries 8. Beardslee, Augustus, 1829, 1834-1838, 1859-1863 Scope and Contents note

Letters concerning financial matters, family (esp. the deaths of Philip Frey and Elizabeth Frey Beardslee), family strife.

 Letters sent: Beardslee, Augustus 1 8 1829, 1834-1838, 1859-1863 Subseries 9. Beardslee, Elizabeth Frey, 1822-1837, undated Scope and Contents note

Letters regarding family, local news, deaths of friend, brother, and child, medical and health matters, child rearing and weaning.

 Letters sent: Beardslee, Elizabeth Frey 1 9 1822-1837, undated Subseries 10. Beardslee, Ethel, 1910-1913, undated Scope and Contents note

Letters concern family news, books read, travels.

 Letters sent: Beardslee, Ethel 1 10 1910-1913, undated Subseries 11. Beekman, J.P. [John], 1838-1839 Scope and Contents note

Letters regarding finances, wool.

 Letters sent: Beekman, J.P. 1 11 1838-1839 Subseries 12. Beekman, Lydia, 1830-1866, undated Scope and Contents note

Letters concern family matters, especially condolence letters for the deaths of Henry Van Schaack Frey, Henry I. Frey, Elizabeth Frey Beardslee, and Phebe Ludlow.

 Letters sent: Beekman, Lydia 1 12 1830-1866 Subseries 13. Beekman, Thomas, 1835-1863 Scope and Contents note

Letters regarding property, finances, family deaths.

 Letters sent: Beekman, Thomas 1 13 1835-1863 Subseries 14. Bishop, John C., 1855-1856 Scope and Contents note

Letters Johnny Frey and Samuel Ludlow Frey concerning school, penmanship, holidays, alcohol, farm life, weather, and politics.

 Letters sent: Bishop, John C. 1 14 1855-1856 Subseries 15. Booth, Emma L., 1883-1898, undated Scope and Contents note

Travel letters from Italy, Scotland.

 Letters sent: Booth, Emma L. 1 15 1855-1856 Subseries 16. Briggs, B.F., 1866-1867 Scope and Contents note

Letters to Henry A. Frey regarding gold mining ventures in the Carolinas, especially at King's Mountain, N.C.

 Letters sent: Briggs, B.F. 1 16 1866-1867 Subseries 17. Letters sent, B Letters sent: B 2 1 Subseries 18. Cantine, Christina, 1821-1852, undated Scope and Contents note

Letters to Caroline Ludlow Frey regarding courtship, friendship, local gossip, religion, social news, local and family deaths.

 Letters sent: Cantine, Christina 2 2 1821-1829 Letters sent: Cantine, Christina 2 3 1836-1852, undated Subseries 19. Conkling family, 1813, 1826, 1845-1864, 1881 Scope and Contents note

Letters from Conkling family members regarding family matters, politics. Includes:

Alfred (1813, 1826, 1848, 1849), Alfred R. (1912), Aurelian (1845-1861), Harriette (1861-1881), Roscoe (1854, 1864).

 Letters sent: Conkling family 2 4 1813, 1826, 1845-1864, 1881 Subseries 20. Cox family, 1833, 1854-1856 Scope and Contents note

Includes letters from Henry F. Cox, including two lengthy letters from abroad (Syria and Egypt, 1856, 1857) that describe his travels throughout the Mid East and down the Nile River. There are also letters from Margaret and Seraphine Cox.

 Letters sent: Cox family 2 5 1833, 1854-1856 Subseries 21. Letters sent, C Letters sent: Ca-Cl 2 6 Letters sent: Co-Cu 2 7 Subseries 22. Davies, Henry E., 1825-1870 Scope and Contents note

Letters, mostly to John Frey, concerning the Davies family, romantic advice, religion, Frey's financial matters, the Civil War.

 Letters sent: Davies, Henry E. 2 8 1825-1870 Subseries 23. Deuel, F. Dygert, 1902-1904 Scope and Contents note

Letters to Samuel Ludlow Frey regarding Herkimer, Dygert and Deuel family genealogies, New York State history.

 Letters sent: Deuel, F. Dygert 2 9 1902-1904 Subseries 24. Letters sent, D Letters sent: D 2 10 Subseries 25. Letters sent, E Letters sent: E 2 11 Subseries 26. Frey, Adelle Reynolds, 1866, 1872-1880, undated ["Dell"] Scope and Contents note

Letters concerning the family farm, weather, family news, health.

 Letters sent: Frey, Adelle 3 1 1866, 1872-1880, undated Subseries 27. Frey, Augustus B., 1851-1883, 1903, 1917, undated ["Gus"] Scope and Contents note

Letters to various family members dealing with family news, his work in the insurance industry, politics (particularly the election of 1860 and his enthusiasm over Lincoln), New York State excursions, the Civil War (Frey joined a Zouaves regiment, the 110th NYSV, in the Union Army summer of 1862), job prospects after the war, weather.

 Letters sent: Frey, Augustus B. 3 2 1851-1862 July Letters sent: Frey, Augustus B. 3 3 1862 Sept.-1871 Letters sent: Frey, Augustus B. 3 4 1873-1883, 1903, 1917, undated Subseries 28. Frey, Caroline Ludlow, 1813-1872, undated Scope and Contents note

Letters to her various family members, children and husband concerning family matters, deaths, religion, health and ailments, advice to children, sewing.

 Letters sent: Frey, Caroline Ludlow 3 5 1813-1862 June Letters sent: Frey, Caroline Ludlow 3 6 1862 Nov.-1872 Letters sent: Frey, Caroline Ludlow (to Caroline Frey Winne) 3 7 Undated Letters sent: Frey, Caroline Ludlow 3 8 Undated Letters sent: Frey, Caroline Ludlow 3 9 Undated Letters sent: Frey, Caroline Ludlow 4 1 Undated Subseries 29. Frey, Caroline, 1873-1886 ["Carrie"] Scope and Contents note

Mostly childhood letters to her grandfather concerning activities on the farm. Also letters from Wells College, Aurora, NY, describing her studies there.

 Letters sent: Frey, Carrie 4 2 1874-1886 Subseries 30. Frey, Elizabeth Van Schaack, 1824-1833, undated ["Betsey"] Scope and Contents note

Letters (most to her son John) offering advice, and detailing family news, her religious convictions, local gossip, and the deaths of three of her children.

 Letters sent: Frey, Elizabeth Van Schaack 4 3 1824-1833, undated Subseries 31. Frey, George H., 1873-1881 Scope and Contents note

Letters (most from Springfield, OH) regarding family news and deaths (particularly his father, wife, and children), family history, politics (esp. the 1876 election and Conkling), Custer, and other contemporary events.

 Letters sent: Frey, George H. 4 4 1873-1881 Subseries 32. Frey, Helen, [1878]-1882, undated Scope and Contents note

Childhood letters about the farm, family.

 Letters sent: Frey, Helen 4 5 [1878]-1882, undated Subseries 33. Frey, Henrietta Swift, 1875-1882 ["Etta"] Scope and Contents note

Letters concerning family news, her children's activities.

 Letters sent: Frey, Henrietta 4 6 1875-1882 Subseries 34. Frey, H[enry], 1847-1864 Scope and Contents note

Letters from Darien, WI, promoting Wisconsin and detailing local life, particularly farming, the railroad. Also discusses the family, health, weather, disease and death, finances, religion, politics (particularly the Republican Party and Roscoe Conkling), the impending secession, and the Civil War.

 Letters sent: Frey, Henry ["H."] 4 7 1847-1864 Subseries 35. Frey, Henry A., 1854-1884, undated ["Harry"] Scope and Contents note

Letters to family members (most from Cleveland, Chicago, and Indiana) regarding family matters, his involvement in coal dealing, various entrepreneurial schemes, continual financial troubles, his attempts to enlist in the Union army, involvement in the Civil War, and in a gold mining venture at King's Mountain, NC. Frey also discusses familial discord, his debts to family members, accusations of impropriety, the dissolution of his marriage, and his emotional troubles. There is a gap in the letters from 1864 to 1866.

 Letters sent: Frey, Henry A. 4 8 1854-1858 Letters sent: Frey, Henry A. 4 9 1859-1860 Letters sent: Frey, Henry A. 4 10 1861-1862 July Letters sent: Frey, Henry A. 5 1 1862 Aug.-1873 Letters sent: Frey, Henry A. 5 2 1874-1878 Letters sent: Frey, Henry A. 5 3 1879 Letters sent: Frey, Henry A. 5 4 1879-1884, undated Subseries 36. Frey, Henry A. [probably son of Augustus B. Frey], 1912 Scope and Contents note

One letter about the birth of his son.

 Letters sent: Frey, Henry A. 5 5 1912 Subseries 37. Frey, Henry I., 1820-1830, undated Scope and Contents note

Letters (most to son John) regarding family and farm news, health, land sales, local news.

 Letters sent: Frey, Henry I. 5 6 1824-1828, undated Subseries 38. Frey, Henry Van Schaack, 1824-1828 Scope and Contents note

Letters describing his school and fellow students, travels in New York State, future plans.

 Letters sent: Frey, Henry Van Schaack 5 7 1824-1828 Subseries 39. Frey, J.W., 1858-1859 Scope and Contents note

Letters about family history, the death of his son.

 Letters sent: Frey, J.W. 5 8 1858-1859 Subseries 40. Frey, John [1806-1886], 1825-1886, undated Scope and Contents note

Early letters detail his schooling, legal studies, his religious conversion at the age of twenty, and his 1828 marriage to Caroline Ludlow. In late1829, Frey accompanied his brother Henry to St. Augustine, FL, where the latter hoped to find respite from his lung ailment. Letters from Florida describe local population, food, Henry's health and subsequent death in early 1830. Frey's letters from 1830 to 1865 concern his finances, family, legal matters, property and land sales, the farm and planting, limestone and willow trees, family strife with the Beardslees, and the Civil War. There is a gap in the letters from 1845 to 1850, and from 1865 to 1872. After 1872, and a move to Hoboken, N.J., the letters concern the death of his wife (1873), his job at the Custom House, New York City, grandchildren, family news and health. There is also a gap from 1874 to 1877.

 Letters sent: Frey, John 5 9 1825-1827 May Letters sent: Frey, John 5 10 1827 June-1829 Oct Letters sent: Frey, John 6 1 1829 Nov-1830 Letters sent: Frey, John 6 2 1831-1844 Letters sent: Frey, John 6 3 1850-1858 Feb Letters sent: Frey, John 6 4 1858 June-1860 June Letters sent: Frey, John 6 5 1860 July-1866 May Letters sent: Frey, John 6 6 1861 June-1862 April Letters sent: Frey, John 7 1 1862 June-1865 Letters sent: Frey, John 7 2 1872-1878 Letters sent: Frey, John 7 3 1879-1886 Letters sent: Frey, John 7 4 Undated Subseries 41. Frey, John ["Johnny" d. 1858], 1856-1857 Scope and Contents note

Letters about farm activities, weather.

 Letters sent: Frey, John 7 5 1856-1857 Subseries 42. Frey, Mary C., 1876-[1880] Scope and Contents note

Letters concern the dissolution of her marriage to Henry A. Frey, and finances.

 Letters sent: Frey, Mary C. 7 6 1876-[1880] Subseries 43. Frey, Philip, 1834 Scope and Contents note

One letter to his mother concerning the family.

 Letters sent: Frey, Philip 7 7 1834 Subseries 44. Frey, Philip R., 1822 Scope and Contents note

One letter to his son about family matters.

 Letters sent: Frey, Philip R. 7 7 1822 Subseries 45. Frey, Samuel C., 1852-1876 Scope and Contents note

Most letters are written from Decatur, AL, and detail family matters and history; opinions on the Civil War, Southern and national politics; local customs, gardening, weather, farming, keeping chickens, and cotton.

 Letters sent: Frey, Samuel C. 7 8 1852-1876 Subseries 46. Frey, Samuel Ludlow, 1850-1917, undated ["Ludlow," "Lud"] Scope and Contents note

Early letters written from school in Poughkeepsie detail his studies, local events, family news (esp. Ludlow family), weddings and social events, dental procedures, and weather. Later letters from Palatine Bridge discuss the family's financial troubles, deaths, land sales, the Civil War, farming and winemaking, and health. There is a gap in the letters from 1865 to 1872. After 1872, his letters continue to describe finances and debt, farming, health, and local news. Also under discussion are his mother's death in 1873, other deaths, politics, the railroad, Henry A. Frey's continual financial troubles, digging for Indian relics, articles written and submitted for publication, and family news. There is another gap in the letters from 1883 to 1895. Later letters concern family and local history, and a dispute with the New York Central & Hudson River Co. over a fence and drainage on Frey property.

 Letters sent: Frey, Samuel Ludlow 7 9 1850-1861 Letters sent: Frey, Samuel Ludlow 7 10 1862-1865 Letters sent: Frey, Samuel Ludlow 8 1 1872-1873 Apr Letters sent: Frey, Samuel Ludlow 8 2 1873 May-1874 Apr. Letters sent: Frey, Samuel Ludlow 8 3 1874 May-1875 June Letters sent: Frey, Samuel Ludlow 8 4 1875 July-1876 Letters sent: Frey, Samuel Ludlow 8 5 1877-1878 Letters sent: Frey, Samuel Ludlow 8 6 1879 Jan-Oct Letters sent: Frey, Samuel Ludlow 8 7 1879 Nov-1880 Letters sent: Frey, Samuel Ludlow 9 1 1881 Letters sent: Frey, Samuel Ludlow 9 2 1882-1883, 1889 Letters sent: Frey, Samuel Ludlow 9 3 1895-1917 Letters sent: Frey, Samuel Ludlow 9 4 Undated Subseries 47. Frey, Sue R., 1875-1878 Scope and Contents note

Letters from Racine, WI, regarding family news and history, health, deaths, women's rights.

 Letters sent: Frey, Sue R. 9 5 1875-1878 Subseries 48. Letters sent, F Letters sent: F 9 6 Subseries 49. Greene, Annie, [19]12-1915 Scope and Contents note

Letters concerning New York State history.

 Letters sent: Greene, Annie 9 7 [19]12-1915 Subseries 50. Greene, Estelle, 1911-[1913], undated Scope and Contents note

Letters about Seattle, social events, travel plans.

 Letters sent: Greene, Estelle 9 7 1911-[1913] Subseries 51. Greene, Helen, 1912 Scope and Contents note

Letters to Samuel Ludlow Frey requesting that he speak before the Montgomery County Historical Society on Sir William Johnson.

 Letters sent: Greene, Helen 9 7 1912 Subseries 52. Greene, Nelson, 1913-1917 Scope and Contents note

Letters to Samuel Ludlow Frey regarding New York State history, and Frey's writings including "The Story of Our River" and "The Mohawks."

 Letters sent: Greene, Nelson 9 8 1913-1917 Subseries 53. Letters sent, G Letters sent: G 9 9 Subseries 54. Havens, Paul E., 1898-1912 Scope and Contents note

Letters to Samuel Ludlow Frey from Leavenworth, KS about family history and news, travels.

 Letters sent: Havens, Paul E. 10 1 1898-1912 Subseries 55. Hees, A., 1857-1876 Scope and Contents note

Letters, presumably to John Frey, containing family and local news, deaths, politics, health, financial matters, the death of Hees' wife, and Frey's legal troubles with George A. Johnson.

 Letters sent: Hees, A. 10 2 1858-1859 Subseries 56. Letters sent, H Letters sent: Ha-He 10 3 Letters sent: Hi-Hy 10 4 Subseries 57. Ives, Jane, 1873-1877, undated Scope and Contents note

Letters from Racine, WI concerning family health, news, deaths.

 Letters sent: Ives, Jane 10 5 1873-1877 Subseries 58. Johnson, George G., 1854-1862 Scope and Contents note

Letters to John Frey regarding local news, finances, property sales, limestone, farming, politics, and the impending Civil War. Johnson also discusses his son Alonzo's financial dealings with Frey and his whereabouts in California.

 Letters sent: Johnson, George G. 10 6 1854-1862 Subseries 59. Jones family, 1899-1913, undated Scope and Contents note

Letters to Samuel Ludlow Frey of holiday greetings, family news, school and college, and travels. Includes:

Barbara (1911-1912), Helen [probably Helen Jones Jr.] (1899, 1910), Helen [probably Helen Jones Sr.] (1910-1911),Wallace (1899, 1910-1913, undated).

 Letters sent: Jones family 10 7 1899-1913, undated Subseries 60. Letters sent, I-J Letters sent: I-J 10 8 Subseries 61. Kane, Elias, 1816-1826 Scope and Contents note

Letters to Henry I. Frey regarding finances, land sales.

 Letters sent: Kane, Elias 10 9 1816-1819 Letters sent: Kane, Elias 10 10 1820-1826 Subseries 62. Knox, Elizabeth, 1838-1876 Scope and Contents note

Letters discussing local news, deaths (particularly of Caroline Ludlow Frey), health and illness.

 Letters sent: Knox, Elizabeth 10 11 1838-1876 Subseries 63. Letters sent, K Letters sent: K 10 12 Subseries 64. Lathrop, Maria Ludlow, 1825, 1835-1851, 1873 Scope and Contents note

Letters concerning family news, illnesses, and deaths (especially the death of her mother Phebe Ludlow); also her husband Rev. L.E. Lathrop's leaving his ministerial post.

 Letters sent: Lathrop, Maria Ludlow 11 1 1825, 1835-1851, 1873 Subseries 65. Lathrop family, 1832, 1841, 1875 Scope and Contents note

Includes: Henry (1841), J.M. (1875), Leonard (1832); 1 item each.

 Letters sent: Lathrop family 11 2 1832, 1841, 1875 Subseries 66. Ludlow, Anna D., 1862, 1868-1900 Scope and Contents note

Letters regarding family news, finances, health and illnesses, the death of her mother (1877), and the family vault. Some letters (1873-1875) are written from Savannah and Charlestown, detailing her work as a teacher of African-American children.

 Letters sent: Ludlow, Anna D. 11 3 1862, 1868-1900 Subseries 67. Ludlow, Ellen, 1873-1900, undated Scope and Contents note

Letters written from Oswego, NY, most to John Frey, concerning the family, health, her father, Samuel Baldwin Ludlow, his illness and death (1882); religion and the local church, women and religion, the Beecher scandal; Oswego news, deaths, politics, weather.

 Letters sent: Ludlow, Ellen 11 4 1873-1881 Letters sent: Ludlow, Ellen 11 5 1882-1900, undated Subseries 68. Ludlow, FitzHugh, 1850-1860, undated Scope and Contents note

Letters, most to Samuel Ludlow Frey, detailing family news, school life, opinions on religion, his religious conversion, lecturing stints.

 Letters sent: Ludlow, FitzHugh 11 6 1850-1860, undated Subseries 69. Ludlow, Helen, 1872-1913, undated Scope and Contents note

Letters about family news, reflections on her father, Rev. Henry Gilbert Ludlow; some items written from the Hampton Institute, Va., but do not go into great detail about school life; others written from St. Augustine, FL.

 Letters sent: Ludlow, Helen 11 7 1872-1913, undated Subseries 70. Ludlow, Henry Gilbert, Rev., 1824-1865, undated Scope and Contents note

Letters concerning the state of religion in New York City, New Haven, Poughkeepsie, religious instruction, Catholicism, cholera (1832), John Frey's financial troubles, illness and family deaths, death of his mother, Phebe Ludlow (1840), births, his children, love letters to his second wife Maria Tappen (1851).

 Letters sent: Ludlow, Rev. Henry Gilbert 11 8 1824-1836 Letters sent: Ludlow, Rev. Henry Gilbert 11 9 1837-1848 Letters sent: Ludlow, Rev. Henry Gilbert 11 10 1851-1865, undated Subseries 71. Ludlow, Maria Beekman Tappen, 1851 Scope and Contents note

Love letters to Rev. Henry Gilbert Ludlow, also discussing family and New York City news, FitzHugh Ludlow's future, and wedding plans.

 Letters sent: Ludlow, Maria Beekman Tappen 11 11 1851 Subseries 72. Ludlow, Nancy Douglas, 1828-1829, 1872[?], undated Scope and Contents note

Letters, most written from Philadelphia, concerning family and local news, religious revivals.

 Letters sent: Ludlow, Nancy Douglas 11 12 1828-1829, 1872[?], undated Subseries 73. Ludlow, Samuel Baldwin, 1825-1881, undated Scope and Contents note

Early letters (through 1831) are written from Philadelphia; from 1836 on, written from Oswego, NY. They discuss family news and troubles, health problems (particularly his eyes), local politics, businesses, including insurance, gas and railroad, politics, Ulysses S. Grant, Roscoe Conkling, racial issues (c1875), the Beecher scandal, his daughter Ellen, the last illness and death of his wife, Nancy Douglas Ludlow (1877), physical ailments.

Ludlow family, others, 1828-1899, undated Scope and Contents note

Includes: Ambrose (1828, 1841; 2 items), [Elizabeth (prob., b.1830)] (1855-1856, undated; 5 items), Harry (1899; 1 item), Phebe (undated; 1 item), Rosalie (1860; 1 item), Samuel Baldwin, Jr. ["Baldwin"] (1856-1857; 4 items).

 Letters sent: Ludlow family, others 12 7 1828-1899, undated Subseries 75. Letters sent, L Letters sent: L 12 8 Subseries 76. Moore, David, 1857-1864 Scope and Contents note

Letters to John Frey, most written from California, regarding the prospects for California, Frey's financial and legal dispute with Alonzo Johnson and the latter's whereabouts, local news.

 Letters sent: Moore, David 12 9 1857-1864 Subseries 77. Letters sent, M Letters sent: M 13 1 Subseries 78. Letters sent, N Letters sent: N 13 2 Subseries 79. Letters sent, O Letters sent: O 13 3 Subseries 80. Pruyn, Margaret Van Schaack, 1824-1841 Scope and Contents note

Letters discussing family news, deaths of various family members.

 Letters sent: Pruyn, Margaret Van Schaack 13 4 1824-1841 Subseries 81. Letters sent, P Letters sent: P 13 5 Subseries 82. Rich, Dexter, 1855, 1858-1862 Scope and Contents note

Letters about the Frey family farm, cows, planting, and finances.

 Letters sent: Rich, Dexter 13 6 1855, 1858-1862 Subseries 83. Letters sent, R Letters sent: R 13 7 Subseries 84. Silvester, Margaret, 1830-1853, undated Scope and Contents note

Letters about family news and deaths.

 Letters sent: Silvester, Margaret 13 8 1830-1853, undated Subseries 85. Letters sent, S Letters sent: S 13 9 Subseries 86. Letters sent, T Letters sent: T 13 10 Subseries 87. Van Schaack, D.[avid], 1821-1868, undated Scope and Contents note

Letters, most to John Frey, concerning land sales, financial matters with Frey, family news and deaths.

 Letters sent: Van Schaack, D.[avid] 13 11 1821-1868, undated Subseries 88. Van Schaack, Henry C., 1836-1873 Scope and Contents note

Letters about family news and deaths, visits, and Henry Van Schaack Frey's grave in St. Augustine.

 Letters sent: Van Schaack, Henry C. 13 12 1836-1873 Subseries 89. Van Schaack, Peter, 1806-1830, undated Scope and Contents note

Letters regarding land, finances, family news, and the death of Henry Van Schaack Frey.

 Letters sent: Van Schaack, Peter 14 1 1806-1830, undated Subseries 90. Van Schaack, Peter Jr., 1820, 1832, 1851, 1862, undated Scope and Contents note

Letters concerning land, his father's health, family news and health.

 Letters sent: Van Schaack, Peter Jr. 14 2 1820, 1832, 1851, 1862, undated Subseries 91. Van Schaack, Peter C., 1825-1879 Scope and Contents note

Letters regarding family news, finances, the deaths of his mother, wife, and Caroline Ludlow Frey, romantic advice to John Frey.

 Letters sent: Van Schaack, Peter C. 14 3 1825-1879 Subseries 92. Van Schaack family, others, 1848-1900, undated Scope and Contents note

Includes: Anna (1877; 2 items), Asa (1848; 1 item), Catherine (1877; 2 items), Christina (1 item), David (1900; 2 items), Dorcas (undated; 1 item), John Jay [probably son of David] (1863-1877; 4 items), Peter [son of Henry C.] (1868, 1899; 5 items).

 Letters sent: Van Schaack family, others 14 4 1848-1900, undated Subseries 93. Letters sent, V Letters sent: V 14 5 Subseries 94. Wagner, P.J., 1839-1873 Scope and Contents note

Letters to John Frey regarding Frey's finances, national politics, land sales, the Wagner family, the Civil War, Frey's legal matters, foreclosure.

 Letters sent: Wagner, P.J. 14 6 1839-1873 Subseries 95. Winne, Caroline Frey Giddings, 1851-1899, undated ["Carrie," "Sis"] Scope and Contents note

On microfilm: Dec. 1874-May 1880, Misc. Reel #61. July 1883-July 1887, Misc. Reel #19.

Letters written from Nebraska (1874-1878) were published in Nebraska History, Spring 1981, pp. 1-46.

Caroline E. Frey married Col. Grotius R. Giddings in 1862; he died in 1867. She married army surgeon Dr. Charles K. Winne in 1874.

Chronology of postings:

1861-1865 Fort Trumbull, CT; New Orleans, LA; Oswego, NY; Palatine Bridge, NY 1874 Dec.-1877 Nov. Sidney Barracks, NE 1877 Nov.-1878 Jan. Fort McPherson, NE 1879 May-1880 May Fort Washakie, WY 1880 Aug. Fort Brady, MI 1880 Oct.-1883 Mar. Fort Schuyler, NY 1883 July-1883 Nov. Fort Winfield Scott, CA 1883 Dec.-1884 Sept. Angel Island, CA 1884 Oct.-1885 July Benicia Barracks, CA 1885 July-1887 July U.S. Arsenal, Benicia, CA 1887 Sept.-1890 May Fort Wadsworth, Staten Island, NY 1891 Nov. Fort Snelling, MN 1899 June Fort Crook, NE

Early letters detail family news and her first husband's illnesses, and her mother's death (1873). Letters from Nebraska (12/1874-1/1878), describe local Native Americans, a meeting with Sitting Bull (2/13/1875), her husband's family troubles, her pregnancy and difficult childbirth (1875), violent incidents in the frontier town, health and small pox, complaints about army life and servants, the death of Crazy Horse (letter 9/9/1877), the birth of Charles K. Winne Jr. (9/30/1877), her husband's position in the army and his opportunities for reappointment. Letters from 1878 through mid-1883 discuss the baby, the journey to Wyoming, and her health; and contain descriptions of Wyoming, including a Shoshone Sundance (5/25/1879). An eighteen-page letter of 6/17/1883 and postcards detail her transcontinental railroad journey to California. Letters from California contain family news; reports of her son's education; reactions to the deaths of Henry A. Frey and her father, John Frey; descriptions of the weather, local life, numerous post transfers; opinions on the Chinese and Chinese servants (see especially letters of 1/3/1886, 4/19/[1887], 10/9/1887).

Note: a number of Caroline Frey Winne's undated letters have been tentatively dated, in pencil and in brackets, by a previous processor. The accuracy of these dates has not been verified, and these letters have been moved into the undated folders at the end of the subseries.

Winne, Charles K., 1875-1877, 1886 Scope and Contents note

Most letters concern Caroline Frey Winne's pregnancy in 1875 and her poor condition following childbirth (baby was stillborn or died soon after). Later letters discuss the birth of Charles K. Winne, Jr. and family matters.

 Letters sent: Winne, Charles K. 16 7 1875-1877, 1886 Subseries 97. Winne, Charles K. Jr., 1886-1911 ["Bopper"] Scope and Contents note

Mostly childhood letters about pets, excursions, family, botany. Later letters discuss family visits.

 Letters sent: Winne, Charles K., Jr. 16 8 1886-1911 Subseries 98. Wynkoop, Francis, 1838-1879 Scope and Contents note

Letters concern John Frey's finances, family matters (both Frey and Wynkoop), mortgages, fishing, and the varnish business.

 Letters sent: Wynkoop, Francis 16 9 1838-1879 Subseries 99. Letters sent, W Letters sent: W 16 10 Subseries 100. Letters sent, Y Letters sent: Y 16 11 Subseries 101. Letters sent, unidentified, 1799-1912, undated Letters sent: unidentified 16 12 1799-1859 Letters sent: unidentified 16 13 1860-1912, undated Subseries 102. Envelopes and stamps, 1893-1902, undated Scope and Contents note

Alienated and blank envelopes; loose stamps.

 Envelopes; stamps 25 4 1893-1902, undated Series II. Diaries, 1821-[18]92, undated Subseries 1. Samuel Ludlow Frey, 1859-1886 Scope and Contents note

Brief entries in pocket diaries concerning family matters, weather, social events, playing cricket, politics, finances, fishing, botany, Indian relic hunting, and articles written. Most entries simply detail daily farm activities such as plowing and planting.

 Diaries: Samuel Ludlow Frey (19 volumes) 17 1859-1886 Subseries 2. Caroline Ludlow [Frey], 1821-1826 Scope and Contents note

Spiritual diaries. Many are unbound, loose sheets. Only the first of these diaries is signed by Caroline Ludlow [Frey], the rest are assumed to be hers. Entries are reflections on religion and particular sermons.

 Diaries: Caroline Ludlow [Frey] 18 1 1821-1826 Subseries 3. [Helen Ludlow], 1860 Scope and Contents note

Pocket diary probably belonging to Helen Ludlow. Entries detail daily household and social activities, family news, her emotional state, reading, cooking, trips to Niagara and Boston, her father's sermons, and what appears to be an aborted courtship. Notes in the back of the volume include a list of daily chores, poetry, and finances.

 Diaries: [Helen Ludlow] 17 1860 Subseries 4. John Frey, 1829-1830 Scope and Contents note

John Frey's brief travel diary of his excursion to St. Augustine, FL with his ailing brother Henry.

 Diary: [John Frey], travels to St. Augustine, FL 18 2 1829-1830 Subseries 5. Unidentified, 1829-[18]92, undated Scope and Contents note

This subseries includes an unidentified author's weather diary for Jan., 1829, an unidentified author's brief travel diary for a trip to Virginia in 1892, and a mostly blank pocket diary of an unidentified author.

 Diary: unidentified, weather 18 2 1829 Jan. 1-12 Diary: unidentified, travel diary to Va. 18 2 1892 Diary: unidentified 17 Undated Series III. Financial Records, 1799-1912, undated Scope and Contents note

This series contains Frey family account books, bills, loose accounts, bonds, promissory notes, receipts, printed reports, and calculations. Sorted by last date on item. Printed reports include insurance company statements and annual reports for the town of Palatine, NY. Account books include two 1863 volumes (possibly belonging to Henry A. Frey) detailing items (alcohol, food, cigars) sold to Union troops.

Financial Records: Account book 19 9 1863 Apr.-Sept. Financial Records: Account book 19 9 1865 Oct. Series IV. Legal Material, 1799-1865, undated Scope and Contents note

This series includes indentures, bonds, court papers (including copies of opinions), notes, drafts of wills, agreements, estate inventories and papers, notices, articles of agreement. Many of the items concern John Frey's financial and legal troubles, especially the undated material.

 Legal material 20 1 1799-1842 Legal material 20 2 1846-1865 Legal material 20 3 Undated Series V. Land and Property Records, 1806-1873, undated Scope and Contents note

Includes surveys, memorandum, records of patent lots, articles of agreement, indentures, and sales of Frey family land. Also one folder of house plans.

 Land and property records 20 4 1806-1847 Land and property records 20 5 1849-1873, undated Land and property records: house plans 20 6 Undated Series VI. Genealogical Material, undated Scope and Contents note

This series includes family trees for the Van Schaack, Ludlow, and Herkimer families, as well as a North family register, and notes on the Herkimer, Yates, and Roach families.

 Genealogical material 20 7 Undated Series VII. Poetry, undated Scope and Contents note

This series contains copies of published poems, as well as poetry that is most likely original, including FitzHugh Ludlow's "Epistle from a brave of the Ludlow Tribe to a distinguished Mohawk," written for his cousin, Samuel Ludlow Frey.

 Poetry 20 8 Undated Series VIII. Ephemera, 1818-[1904], undated Scope and Contents note

Includes invitations, announcements, and programs for various events including balls, festivals, weddings, meetings, concerts, tournaments, and historical commemorations (including the 1876 centennial and an anniversary celebration of the Emancipation Proclamation at Hampton Institute); an announcement for the sale of the Frey family farm; death notices; advertisements for barbed wire fences, farm machinery, health remedies, wine making paraphernalia; circulars for beehives and globes; direct mail from the Republican State Committee; calling cards; catalogs for an antique auction with notes; and a railroad timetable for the Chicago, Burlington, and Quincy Railroad.

 Ephemera: invitations, announcements, programs 20 9 1854-1891, undated Ephemera: announcement, sale of Frey farm 20 10 1856 Ephemera: death notices 20 11 1818, [1873]-1886, undated Ephemera: advertisements 20 12 1884, undated Ephemera: circulars, direct mail 20 13 1880-1899, undated Ephemera: calling cards 20 14 Undated Ephemera: auction catalogs 20 15 [1904] Ephemera: railroad timetable 20 16 1878 Series IX. Organizational Material, 1880-1911, undated Scope and Contents note

This series contains material relating to the meetings of various organizations, including the American Association for the Advancement of Science, the Oneida Historical Society, the Scotch-Irish Society of America, and the Daughters of the American Revolution. Also included is the handwritten, undated "Eighth Annual Report of the Female Praying Society."

 Organizational material 21 1 1880-1911, undated Series X. Educational Material, 1833-1857, undated Scope and Contents note

This series contains report cards, an achievement certificate for Frey children, and two school notebooks.

 Report cards, certificate 21 2 1851, 1857, undated Notebook: Ceylina North, "Practical Arithmetic" 21 3 1833 Notebook: unidentified [possibly Elizabeth Frey], "Deffinitions," geographical terms 21 4 Undated Series XI. Drafts, 1799, 1852, undated Scope and Contents note

Drafts for Samuel Ludlow Frey's, The Story of Our River and The Colonel and the Major. Also a draft of an article probably written by Frey, "Were They Mound Builders," and a brief, early essay of his (possibly for school) entitled "Old, times." Drafts of writings in the hand of John Frey discuss politics, slavery, homeopathy, and insurance. This series also includes what appear to be drafts of addresses, in the hand of John Frey. Topics include temperance, farming and agriculture, slavery, religion, politics, and education. As one document names Frey as recorder for an unnamed society, these addresses are not necessarily his own work. In addition, three drafts of works by unidentified authors are located in this series.

 Drafts: SLF, The Colonel and the Major, Ch. 1-2 21 5 Undated Drafts: SLF, The Colonel and the Major, Ch. 3-4 21 6 Undated Drafts: SLF, The Colonel and the Major, Ch. 5-6 21 7 Undated Drafts: SLF, The Colonel and the Major, Ch. 7-8 21 8 Undated Drafts: SLF, The Colonel and the Major, Ch. 9-10 21 9 Undated Drafts: SLF, The Colonel and the Major, Ch. 11 21 10 Undated Drafts: SLF, The Story of Our River, Ch. 1-3 22 1 Undated Drafts: SLF, The Story of Our River, Ch. 4-5 22 2 Undated Drafts: SLF, The Story of Our River, Ch. 8-9 22 3 Undated Drafts: [SLF], others 22 4 1852, undated Drafts: bulk [John Frey] 22 5 Undated Drafts: addresses, bulk [John Frey] 22 6 1799, undated Drafts: addresses [John Frey] 22 7 Undated Series XII. Notes, Memoranda and Extracts, 1849-1891, undated Scope and Contents note

Many of the loose sheets are unidentified. They include extracts from plays, speeches, newspapers; quotations; axioms; religious notes; fragments of writings on various topics; lists; exercises. Notes attributed to Samuel Ludlow Frey have been previously separated. They consist of notes about history and books; quotations; and extracts.

Bound notebooks include Samuel Ludlow Frey's "Flora of Palatine"; an unidentified volume containing "Speech of Hon. Hen. Wilson," and religious reflections and notes; an unidentified volume containing notes on the history of upstate New York; Mary Tank's notebook of pressed flowers; and a blank notebook belonging to John Frey.

Hen. Wilson," religious reflections and notes 23 7 Undated Notebook: unidentified, historical notes of upstate New York 23 7 Undated Notebook: John Frey, blank 23 7 Undated Series XIII. Gold Mine Documents, 1844-1866 Scope and Contents note

This series includes documents relating to Henry A. Frey's involvement in a gold mining venture in South Carolina, including gold bullion deposit receipts, copies of indentures, articles of agreement, leases, and surveys.

 Gold mine documents 23 8 1844-1866 Series XIV. Newspapers, Clippings and Reprints, 1860-1907, undated Scope and Contents note

Contains newspapers and clippings, mostly from upstate New York publications, many of which contain articles by Samuel Ludlow Frey. Also reprints of articles, most from the Utica Morning Herald, regarding Samuel Ludlow Frey, his interests, and the Oneida Historical Society.

 Newspapers, clippings 24 1 Newspapers, clippings 24 2 Newspapers, clippings 24 3 Newspapers, clippings 24 4 Newspapers, clippings 24 5 Reprints 24 6 Series XV. Sketches, undated Scope and Contents note

Sketches of various unlabeled plants and flowers, a profile of a child, and a sketch presumably by Carrie Frey Winne, of the San Francisco Bay area.

 Sketches 25 1 Undated Series XVI. Photograph, undated Scope and Contents note

One cased daguerreotype portrait of three unidentified men.

 Photograph 25 2 Undated Series XVII. Fragments, undated Scope and Contents note

Blank pieces of paper, blank forms, and one flattened wax seal of an unidentified building.

 Fragments 25 3 Undated
